main event: An orange light was observed low in the northwest sky over Hartford, Indiana for three consecutive nights from May 20-23, 1964.
interesting points: The sighting involved a single stationary object reported over several nights., There was a probable explanation that it was Venus during its setting., Multiple independent sightings reported lights that were stationary and moving., Police officers in surrounding areas also reported unusual lights., Noise complaints connected to an emergency run were received around the same time.
witness description: Two men reported seeing the orange light and one police officer confirmed it.
